wikipedia_page.main: Alexander "Alec" William Pearson (30 November 1853 – 27 January 1930) was a rugby union international who represented England from 1875 to 1878. He was described as late as 1925 as "about as fíne a full back as ever played", and was the first Australian born rugby union international.

link_mentions.page: Guy's, Kings and St Thomas' Rugby Football Club

response: * Alexander William Pearson (born 1854), rugby union international who represented England
*Alexander William Pearson (1854–1930), rugby union international for England from 1875-1878.
